DataElement.preferredName: New Primary Melanoma Anatomic Site Other Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that describes the anatomic site of another new primary cutaneous melanoma that was not previously mentioned or specified.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: New Primary Cutaneous Melanoma Anatomic Site
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Anatomic site of new primary malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: New; having no previous example or precedent or parallel.:Occurring first in time or sequence; original. (American Heritage Dictionary):A malignant neoplasm derived from cells that are capable of forming melanin.

Concepts.definition: Having no previous example or precedent or parallel; of a kind not seen before.
Occurring first in time or sequence; original; of greatest rank or importance or value.

A primary melanoma arising from atypical melanocytes in the skin.  Precursor lesions include acquired and congenital melanocytic nevi, and dysplastic nevi.  Several histologic variants have been recognized, including superficial spreading melanoma, acral lentiginous melanoma, nodular melanoma, and lentigo maligna melanoma.

Property.preferredDefinition: Named locations of, or within, the body.

Concepts.definition: Named locations of or within the body.
